movies.title: The St. Valentine's Day Massacre
movies.plot: Chicago February 14th 1929. Al Capone finally establishes himself as the city's boss of organised crime. In a north-side garage his hoods, dressed as policemen, surprise and mow down with machine-guns the key members of Bugs Moran's rival gang. The film traces the history of the incident, and the lives affected and in some cases ended by it.

movies.title: In Cold Blood
movies.plot: After a botched robbery results in the brutal murder of a rural family, two drifters elude police, in the end coming to terms with their own mortality and the repercussions of their vile atrocity.
movies.awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 4 wins & 7 nominations.

events.title: Perry Smith and Richard Hickock are executed for their crimes
Perry Smith and Richard Hickock murder the Clutter family
Perry Smith and Richard Hickock are captured by police in Las Vegas

movies.plot: 6-18-67 is a short quasi-documentary film by George Lucas regarding the making of the Columbia film “Mackenna's Gold”. This non-story, non-character visual tone poem is made up of nature imagery, time-lapse photography, and the subtle sounds of the Arizona desert.

movies.title: Robbery
movies.plot: A dramatization of the Great Train Robbery. While not a 'how to', it is very detail dependent, showing the care and planning that took place to pull it off.

movies.title: I Killed Rasputin
movies.plot: Grigori Rasputin becomes a fixture of Russia's Imperial Court after saving the life of Alexei Nikolaevich, Tsarevich of Russia, the haemophiliac heir to the throne. However as war breaks out, Rasputin's enemies see him as a cause and plot fatal revenge against the Russian mystic.
